access.headline: Mission Access Console
access.subheadline: Single sign-on for council members, researchers, and operators. Use OAuth or hardware-backed passkeys to reach the admin surface in seconds.

providers.name: Apple
providers.hint: Use Face ID, Touch ID, or passcode backed accounts

providers.name: GitHub
providers.hint: Best for engineers linking repos and CI

passkeys.title: Passkeys & Biometrics
passkeys.description: Register once, then unlock with Face ID, Touch ID, Windows Hello, or a YubiKey. Zero passwords, zero phishing.
passkeys.support_copy: Passkeys sync with iCloud Keychain, Google Password Manager, and 1Password.

access.support_note: Need another provider or SSO hookup? Ping security@nsa.pk.

timeline.title: Hit Send. We Reply Fast.
timeline.description: Fill the form, attach your work, tell us your vibe. Our wing leads review every application and route you to the right squad within 72 hours. No black boxes, no ghosting.

timeline.title: Real Talk with Squad Leads
timeline.description: Forget HR scripts. You'll sit down (virtually or IRL) with actual builders who run the wing you're joining. They want to know what you geek out on, where you see yourself, and if the squad's mission clicks for you.

timeline.title: Shadow Mode: Learn by Doing
timeline.description: You're not sitting in onboarding hell watching slides. From day one, you're paired with a mentor and thrown into live projects. Break things, ship fixes, ask dumb questions â€” that's how you learn our cadence.

timeline.title: Ship Something. Show Everyone.
timeline.description: Launch reviews are where you present what you built, what you learned, and what's next. The whole council watches. The feedback is direct. The recognition is real. Then you level up and do it again.

impact.title: Members publish research
impact.description: More than three quarters of active researchers submit work to journals, conferences, or tech blogs every season.

impact.title: Ship production code
impact.description: Engineers push code that reaches real users inside and outside the campus within their first two quarters.

impact.title: Lead major events
impact.description: Event specialists own flagship conferences, hackathons, and workshops with cross-campus partners.

questions.question: When does recruitment close?
questions.answer: NSA operates on rolling cohorts now. Submit whenever you're ready and expect an update from the council within 72 hours.

questions.question: Do I need to be a CS student to join NSA?
questions.answer: NSA welcomes students from every NUST school. Diverse disciplines strengthen our AI work, so engineering, business, design, and biosciences students are encouraged to apply.

questions.question: Can first-year students participate?
questions.answer: Yes. We actively recruit freshmen and sophomores so they can learn, contribute, and grow into leadership roles throughout their time at NUST.

questions.question: What's the selection process?
questions.answer: Submit the Google Form, pass a skills and motivation screening, complete a 15-20 minute interview, and receive results within 48 hours of the conversation.

questions.question: What do NSA members work on?
questions.answer: Members ship AI products, run research experiments, craft design systems, and lead operations for large-scale events and partnerships across NUST.

directorates.name: Research Directorate

directorates.name: Strategy Directorate

social_widgets.email_note: Your note arrives directly in the NSA inbox. Expect a reply within 24 hours.
